com.kudler.markmywords.service

Class MarkovService

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.kudler.markmywords.service.MarkovService

  • @Service
public class MarkovService
extends java.lang.Object
    Service designed to take in text strings from any source and create Markov Chains out of them.

      Generate a Markov Chain by creating a prefix, and then appending suffixes to it one at a time until we reach our word limit or we reach randomly choose the last word in the source string.

    • Method Detail

      • chain

        public java.lang.String chain(java.lang.String text,
                              int size,
                              int maxWords,
                              java.lang.String prefix)
        Generate a Markov Chain by creating a prefix, and then appending suffixes to it one at a time until we reach our word limit or we reach randomly choose the last word in the source string.
        Parameters:
        text - Source string that will be transformed
        size - Number of words to use as a prefix
        maxWords - Upper bound on when to terminate Markov string.
        prefix - optional string to start our transformation.
        Returns:
        String of words representing our generated Markov Chain

      • buildPrefixTable

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> buildPrefixTable(java.lang.String text,
                                                                                              int size)
        Helper method to create data structure containing every adjacent word grouping - or "prefix" in our text string, then matching them with their following word - or "suffix". Traditionally, prefixes and suffixes are mapped via matrix, but we will keep our prefixes indexed in a hashtable, so that access to a suffix list will be O(1).
        Parameters:
        text - The text that will be broken down into a HashMap of prefixes as keys, and a list of suffixes as values.
        size - The size of each prefix. For example, if size=2, every 2 adjacent words will grouped and used as keys in the table.
        Returns:
        A HashMap containing every possible of word grouping in "text" of size "size". Each key in the table points to an array list containing the succeeding word from the original "text" string.

      • buildPrefixString

        public java.lang.String buildPrefixString(java.lang.String[] words,
                                          int start,
                                          int end)
        Helper method to abstract grouping words together to form a prefix.
        Parameters:
        words - Array of every word in a text string, separated by whitespace.
        start - First index in subarray that we will be concatenating, inclusive
        end - Last index of subarray, exclusive
        Returns:
        String concatenating all words from start to end with a whitespace.
